history.proof: intros U A B H. unfold Same_set. split. - intros x H'. apply Intersection_inv in H'. apply H'. - intros x H'. apply Intersection_intro. + qsimpl time: 2. + qsimpl time: 2.

exceptions.exn: In environment U : Type A, B : Ensemble U H : Included A B x : U H' : In U A x Unable to unify "Included A B" with "In U A x".
No such goal. Focus next goal with bullet +.
In environment U : Type A, B : Ensemble U H : Included A B x : U H' : In U A x Unable to unify "In U A x" with "In U B x".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (U : Type) (A B : Ensemble U), Included A B -> Same_set (Intersection U A B) A

Premises:
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula For GFormula: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For TT: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For FF: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For X: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For A: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For Cj: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit
Same_set = fun (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) => Included B C /\ Included C B : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Prop Argument U is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
Ensemble = fun U : Type => U -> Prop : Type -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
Intersection : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Ensemble U
Included = fun (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) => forall x : U, In U B x -> In U C x : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Prop Argument U is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
Hurkens.Generic.U : forall (U1 : Type) (El1 : U1 -> Type), (forall u : U1, (El1 u -> U1) -> U1) -> ((U1 -> U1) -> U1) -> U1 -> U1
Extensionality_Ensembles : forall (U : Type) (A B : Ensemble U), Same_set A B -> A = B
Setminus_intro : forall (U : Type) (A B : Ensemble U) (x : U), In U A x -> ~ In U B x -> In U (Setminus U A B) x
Union_iff : forall (U : Type) (A B : Ensemble U) (x : U), In U (Union U A B) x < -> In U A x \/ In U B x
Decidable.dec_and : forall A B : Prop, Decidable.decidable A -> Decidable.decidable B -> Decidable.decidable (A /\ B)
Decidable.not_and : forall A B : Prop, Decidable.decidable A -> ~ (A /\ B) -> ~ A \/ ~ B
Included_Empty : forall (U : Type) (A : Ensemble U), Included (Empty_set U) A
snd = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (_, y) := p in y : forall A B : Type, A * B -> B Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
Intersection_assoc : forall (A : Type) (P Q R : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A (Intersection A P Q) R) (Intersection A P (Intersection A Q R))
Add_intro1 : forall (U : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (x y : U), In U A y -> In U (Add U A x) y
Intersection_Union_distr_l : forall (A : Type) (P Q R : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A (Union A Q R) P) (Union A (Intersection A Q P) (Intersection A R P))
Intersection_Union_distr_r : forall (A : Type) (P Q R : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A P (Union A Q R)) (Union A (Intersection A P Q) (Intersection A P R))
Intersection_comm : forall (A : Type) (P Q : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A P Q) (Intersection A Q P)
Disjoint_intro : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U), (forall x : U, ~ In U (Intersection U B C) x) -> Disjoint U B C
Intersection_Complement : forall (A : Type) (P Q : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A (Complement A P) (Complement A Q)) (Complement A (Union A P Q))
Intersection_intro : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (x : U), In U B x -> In U C x -> In U (Intersection U B C) x
Add_inv : forall (U : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (x y : U), In U (Add U A x) y -> In U A y \/ x = y
Intersection_inv : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (x : U), In U (Intersection U B C) x -> In U B x /\ In U C x
Inhabited_add : forall (U : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (x : U), Inhabited U (Add U A x)
List.Forall2_nil : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop), List.Forall2 R nil nil
Extension : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U), B = C -> Same_set B C
Add_not_Empty : forall (U : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (x : U), Add U A x <> Empty_set U
Add_intro2 : forall (U : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (x : U), In U (Add U A x) x
not_Empty_Add : forall (U : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (x : U), Empty_set U <> Add U A x
Inhabited_intro : forall (U : Type) (B : Ensemble U) (x : U), In U B x -> Inhabited U B
Union_introl : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (x : U), In U B x -> In U (Union U B C) x
List.Forall2_cons : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> List.Forall2 R l l' -> List.Forall2 R (x :: l) (y :: l')
Disjoint_sind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : SProp), ((forall x : U, ~ In U (Intersection U B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint U B C -> P
Disjoint_rec : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : Set), ((forall x : U, ~ In U (Intersection U B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint U B C -> P
Disjoint_ind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : Prop), ((forall x : U, ~ In U (Intersection U B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint U B C -> P
Disjoint_rect : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : Type), ((forall x : U, ~ In U (Intersection U B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint U B C -> P
Union_inv : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (x : U), In U (Union U B C) x -> In U B x \/ In U C x
Union_assoc : forall (A : Type) (P Q R : Ensemble A), Same_set (Union A (Union A P Q) R) (Union A P (Union A Q R))
Union_comm : forall (A : Type) (P Q : Ensemble A), Same_set (Union A P Q) (Union A Q P)
Inductive prod (A B : Type) : Type := pair : A -> B -> A * B For pair: Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted For prod: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For pair: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _ _]
Union_intror : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (x : U), In U C x -> In U (Union U B C) x
Inhabited_ind : forall (U : Type) (B : Ensemble U) (P : Prop), (forall x : U, In U B x -> P) -> Inhabited U B -> P
Inhabited_sind : forall (U : Type) (B : Ensemble U) (P : SProp), (forall x : U, In U B x -> P) -> Inhabited U B -> P
Strict_Included_intro : forall (U : Type) (X Y : Ensemble U), Included X Y /\ X <> Y -> Strict_Included U X Y
Intersection_sind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> SProp), (forall x : U, In U B x -> In U C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Intersection U B C u -> P u
Intersection_ind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> Prop), (forall x : U, In U B x -> In U C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Intersection U B C u -> P u

```coq
intros U A B H.
unfold Same_set.
split.
- intros x H'.
  apply Intersection_inv in H'.
  apply H'.
- intros x H'.
  apply Intersection_intro.
  + apply H.
    apply H'.
  + apply H'.
Qed.
Qed.```

original: intros U A B H. unfold Same_set. split. - intros x H'. apply Intersection_inv in H'. apply H'. - intros x H'. apply Intersection_intro. + apply H. apply H'. + apply H'.
